info.document:
Editor: Simon Cameron-Moore  + 65 6870 3593
Picture Desk: Singapore         + 65 6870 3775
Graphics queries:                + 65 6870 3595

(All times GMT/ET)
TOP STORIES
North Korea says seeking military 'equilibrium' with U.S.
SEOUL/UNITED NATIONS, Sept 16 (Reuters) - North Korea said
on Saturday it aims to reach an "equilibrium" of military force
with the United States, which earlier signaled its patience for
diplomacy is wearing thin after Pyongyang fired a missile over
Japan for the second time in under a month.
(NORTHKOREA-MISSILES/ (WRAPUP 2, PIX, TV, GRAPHIC), moved, by
Chritstine Kim and Michelle Nichols, 1,000 words)

Bomb injures 29 on London train; threat level raised as
police hunt suspects
LONDON - Home-made bomb on packed rush-hour commuter train
in London engulfs carriage in flames and injures 29 people, but
apparently fails to fully explode, in Britain's fifth major
terrorism incident this year. (BRITAIN-SECURITY/LONDON (UPDATE
10, PIX, TV), moved, by Kevin Coombs and Yann Tessier, 987
words)
+ See also:
- BRITAIN-SECURITY/MAY-TRUMP (UPDATE 2), moved, 389 words

Myanmar bars U.S. official from Rohingya conflict zone
YANGON - Myanmar says visiting U.S. official would not be
allowed to go to region where violence has triggered  exodus of
nearly 400,000 Rohingya Muslims that the United Nations has
branded a "textbook example of ethnic cleansing".
(MYANMAR-ROHINGYA/ (UPDATE 3, TV, PIX), moved, by Wa Lone and
Shoon Naing, 880 words)
+ See also:
MYANMAR-ROHINGYA/BANGLADESH-IMAGE (PIX), moved, 300 words

Trump to 'slap' foes, embrace friends in first U.N. speech
-envoy
WASHINGTON - President Donald Trump will pummel foes and
embrace friends in his first speech to U.N. General Assembly
next week, keeping pressure on Washington's adversaries North
Korea  and Iran, U.S. Ambassador Nikki Haley says.
(UN-ASSEMBLY/TRUMP (PIX, TV), moved, by Jeff Mason and Roberta
Rampton, 340 words)

UNITED STATES
Protesters pour into St. Louis streets after murder
acquittal for ex-cop
ST. LOUIS - Hundreds of protesters pour into St. Louis'
streets and some scuffles break out as they voice their anger
after Missouri judge rules white former St. Louis police officer
is not guilty of murder in 2011 shooting of black man.
(MISSOURI-CRIME/ (UPDATE 9, PIX, TV), moved, by Valerie
Volcovici and Kenny Bahr, 757 words)
+ See also:
- MISSOURI-CRIME/JUDGE, 580 words, by Chris Kenning, moved
About 1.7 million, mostly in Florida, without power in
Irma's wake
MIAMI - Nearly 1.7 million homes and businesses in U.S.
Southeast remain without power, including 46 of Florida's nearly
700 nursing homes caught in path of deadly Hurricane Irma.
(STORM-IRMA/ (UPDATE 2, PIX, TV), moving shortly, by Zachary
Fagenson, 400 words)

Pastors stand firm as Trump's U.S. evangelical base weakens
WASHINGTON - New Reuters/Ipsos poll shows that President
Donald Trump's popularity among white evangelicals weakens,
suggesting his grassroots support may not be unconditional.
(USA-TRUMP/EVANGELICALS (GRAPHIC, TV, PIX), moved, by Ayesha
Rascoe and Chris Kahn, 960 words)


AMERICAS
EXCLUSIVE-Canada sought to resolve Boeing military, trade
disputes at meeting -sources
OTTAWA/MONTREAL - Canada last month attempted to end
deepening dispute with Boeing by suggesting it could withdraw
threat not to buy Super Hornet jets if U.S. firm dropped trade
challenge against Canadian planemaker Bombardier, three people
with knowledge of matter tell Reuters. (BOEING-BOMBARDIER/CANADA
(EXCLUSIVE, UPDATE 1, PIX), moved, by David Ljunggren and
Allison Lampert, 541 words)


MIDDLE EAST
U.S.-backed Syrian fighters say will not let government
forces cross Euphrates
BEIRUT - U.S.-backed Syrian militias will not let government
forces cross Euphrates River in their bid to recover eastern
Syria, their commander says, but Russia says army units already
do so near city of Deir al-Zor. (MIDEAST-CRISIS/SYRIA (UPDATE 1,
PIX), moved, by Tom Perry and Sarah Dadouch, 787 words)

Turkey, Iran and Russia to deploy observers around Syria's
Idlib
ANKARA/ASTANA- Russia, Iran and Turkey will post observers
on the edge of a de-escalation zone in northern Syria's Idlib
region largely controlled by Islamist militants, the three
nations say. (MIDEAST-CRISIS/SYRIA-TURKEY-MINISTRY (UPDATE 4,
PIX), moved, by Ece Toksabay and Raushan Nurshayeva, 590 words)

Iraq's Kurdish parliament backs Sept 25 independence
referendum
ERBIL, Iraq - Parliament of Iraq's autonomous Kurdistan
region approves plan to conduct referendum on independence Sept.
25, ignoring opposition from Baghdad and wider region as well as
Western concerns that vote could spark fresh conflict.
(MIDEAST-CRISIS/IRAQ-KURDS-VOTE (UPDATE 4, TV, PIX), moved, by
Raya Jalabi, 650 words)

AFRICA
JOHANNESBURG - Global auditor KPMG clears out its South
African leadership en masse after damning findings from
internal investigation into work done for businessmen friends of
President Jacob Zuma. (KPMG-SAFRICA/ (UPDATE 5, PIX, TV), moved,
by Ed Cropley and Joe Brock, 750 words )

SPACE
Cassini spacecraft ends 13-year odyssey with fiery plunge
into Saturn
U.S. space agency NASA receives final signal from its
Cassini spacecraft as it ends ground-breaking, 13-year Saturn
mission with meteor-like plunge into ringed planet's atmosphere.
(SPACE-SATURN/CASSINI (UPDATE 3, PIX, TV), moved, by Ian
Simpson, 499 words)
